trans-unit.source: Defines column-specific properties that apply to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Grid"></xref> elements.
ColumnDefinition uses its own special structure, a <xref:System.Windows.GridLength>, to describe its width characteristics.
<xref:System.Windows.GridLength> allows a ColumnDefinition to support variable distribution of available space.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> class.
Gets a value that represents the actual calculated width of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref>.
This property is a calculated value that is based on other width inputs and the layout system.

When you add or remove rows or columns, the ActualWidth for all <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition> elements and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinition.ActualHeight%2A> of all <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinition> elements becomes zero until <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Measure%2A> is called.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the actual calculated width in device independent pixels.
The default value is 0.0.
Gets or sets a value that represents the maximum width of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref>.

When you use these values together in the same code example, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition.MinWidth%2A> value takes precedence over the MaxWidth value, which in turn takes precedence over the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition.Width%2A> value.

When you add or remove rows or columns, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition.ActualWidth%2A> for all <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition> elements and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinition.ActualHeight%2A> of all <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinition> elements becomes zero until <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Measure%2A> is called.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` - or - ``` ## XAML Values *double* String representation of a value equal to or greater than `0.0034` but equal to or less than `160000`.
An unqualified value is measured in device independent pixels.
Strings need not explicitly include decimal points.
*qualifiedDouble* A *double* value as described above, (excepting `Auto`) followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`, `cm`, `pt`.

`px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] `in` is inches; 1in==96px `cm` is centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54) px `pt` is points; 1pt==(96/72) px ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the maximum width.
The default value is <xref:System.Double>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition.MaxWidth*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that represents the minimum width of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref>.

When you use these values together in the same code example, the MinWidth value takes precedence over the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition.MaxWidth%2A> value, which in turn takes precedence over the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition.Width%2A> value.

When you add or remove rows or columns , the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition.ActualWidth%2A> for all <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition> elements and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinition.ActualHeight%2A> of all <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinition> elements becomes zero until <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Measure%2A> is called.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` - or - ``` ## XAML Values *double* String representation of a value equal to or greater than `0.0034` but equal to or less than `160000`.
An unqualified value is measured in device independent pixels.
Strings need not explicitly include decimal points.
*qualifiedDouble* A *double* value as described above, (excepting `Auto`) followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`, `cm`, `pt`.

`px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] `in` is inches; 1in==96px `cm` is centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54) px `pt` is points; 1pt==(96/72) px ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the minimum width.
The default value is 0.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition.MinWidth*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets a value that represents the offset value of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref>.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the offset of the column.
The default value is 0.0.

Gets the calculated width of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref> element, or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> value of a column that is defined by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition"></xref>.
The default <xref:System.Windows.GridUnitType> is <xref:System.Windows.GridUnitType>.

When you add or remove rows or columns, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition.ActualWidth%2A> for all <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition> elements and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinition.ActualHeight%2A> of all <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinition> elements becomes zero until <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Measure%2A> is called.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The <xref href="System.Windows.GridLength"></xref> that represents the width of the Column.
The default value is 1.0.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition.Width*> dependency property.
To be added.
